page.title: 06OMPTON VILLAGE, KNEESALL.
page.content: One Monday we went down to Ompton to see Mrs.Prinold.We talked to her about the family's farm and Ompton.When they first started dairy farming at Ompton in the mid 1930's it was very wild and not very good pasture land,but it has gradually changed and their herd has grown.With good management and the use of fertilisers,the land has improved.On commencing farming they only had a herd of 30 cows because they had to milk by hand,but now they milk by machine.The family have 160 acres and have 90 cows in milk. Omton is a small village, with no shop or pub and people have to go several miles for goods or for entertainment.But in some ways life is better than before because of the use of modern machines and power.The young people though often leave the area when they are adults.
